page.content:
{ EDUCATION IN LEIGH AND BRANSFORD (2)
The school began in 1861 as Leigh Hurst (meaning 'a wooded hillock') and it continued under that name when the National school gave way to a Board school in 1932, housed in its new 'temporary' wooden building. At this time the secondary age children began to go to schools in Malvern - first Senior, then 'Modern' and now High schools.
There have been additions to the original wooden schoolroom in the shape of a double 'demountable' unit, 'Portaloos' for sanitary purposes, plus sheds to house various kinds of equipment. Its finest features are its site and its playing field. It became Bransford Primary School in the 1970's and now has some 50 children.
